step1.sentence: The building collapsed because the contractor had cut corners on the foundation materials.

step2.story: Management pushed for the product to launch a month early. The engineering team warned that cutting corners on testing would lead to bugs, but the pressure was too great to resist.

step3.story: The catering company had built its reputation on careful, hand-crafted food. When they started taking on twice the number of events per weekend, the chef noticed the team was beginning to cut corners — using pre-made sauces, skipping resting time on the meat, rushing plating. Complaints followed within a month. The owner sat the team down and made a choice: fewer events, done properly, rather than more events done badly. It cost them short-term revenue but saved the brand they had spent eight years building.

meaning.realUsageKo: 시간이나 비용을 아끼기 위해 품질이나 절차를 희생시킬 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 커브 길에서 안쪽 모서리를 가로질러 가는 지름길 운전에서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 부정적인 의미가 강하며, 결과적으로 문제를 일으키는 맥락에서 자주 등장합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We cannot cut corners when safety is at stake.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 안전이 걸린 문제에서는 대충 할 수 없어요.
